 I. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָסַס‎</span>] **verb** ==be sick== (?; compare Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***id.***, and especially <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***debilis, infirmus, aegrotans***, etc., [[BDB#PS|PS]]<sup>2387</sup>; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְסַס‎</span> ***be sad***; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***nasâsu***</u></abbr>, ***wail***, ***lament*** [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 472</sup>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> is ***go at a gentle pace***); — only **Qal** ***Participle active*** (si vera lectio) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּמְסֹס נֹסֵס‎</span> [[Isa.10.18|Isa 10:18]] like the wasting away ***of a sick man*** (so [[BDB#Thes|Thes]] [[BDB#Ew|Ew]] [[BDB#De|De]] [[BDB#Che|Che]] [[BDB#Di|Di]] [[BDB#Du|Du]]).
